posts.name: Hannes
posts.cooked:
What do you think about a collection of links that have been sent by a contact in the “All Media” preview (or somewhere else)? I don’t know if there is another messenger which does that and in my opinion it would be a great feature to have all your sent links in one place.

Pretty often when someone sends a hyperlink to me and I continue texting with that person, it is not that easy to find that link again between all the messages, so it would be nice if there was a place where I can easily find that link again.
What do you think about this?

link_counts.title: Chat Search doesn't search for/find URLs
Feature to view all media in chat
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.6 release
Separate tabs for images and videos in all/recent media view

posts.cooked: WhatsApp offers this feature as one of three tabs in the “all media” section of a conversation.

posts.name: Hannes
posts.cooked: Well, I didn’t know that. Nevertheless this would still be a great feature people switching from Whatsapp wouldn’t miss it then.

posts.name: bluevox.47
posts.cooked:
jack410:

What do you think about this?

This is a feature that I miss

posts.name: Zeh
posts.cooked:
That would be a nice feature to have

It would be nice to have some new tabs when we open the “All Media”.

Links -> containing all the links the person sent me
Favorites -> This one is a bit more complex because we would need a way to mark a message as favorite and having that issue this tab should display the messages I marked as favorite for that conversation.

Links sections

Disclaimer: I know link previews are not working for most of the Signal users.

But when they will eventually work, I would like to suggest a section like this inside the conversation, where I can see all the links exchanged with my conversation partner:

(screenshot from iMessage)

image828×1792 254 KB

Since 3.16 version of Signal for iOS finally make the link preview feature usable, I pledge again a request for a feature like this (see message above with a screenshot from iMessage). A section in the conversation or group options where I can see all media (web links) exchanged inside that conversation or group.

If link previews are disabled in the client, that section can be hidden.

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 3.16 release iOS Beta Feedback
I don’t like that the whole url is shown in link previews. Instead you could just hide the url in the message, because a shortened link is already under the title of the webpage. Also please don’t write the shortened url in capitals.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 3.16 release
Don't save link preview as image

posts.cooked:
However this is implemented, please make it so that it’s easy to either “jump” to the message with the link or reply to it.

The use case is that I finally read a link that was shared last week and want to reply with my thoughts

As the group chat use case becomes more popular, links are shared more and more. This would be super useful.

posts.name: ch4tterb0x
posts.cooked:
anon17534525:

If link previews are disabled in the client, that section can be hidden.

I think disabling link preview should only disable the preview in the overview of the links or doesn’t even have an effect on it at all. (Not quite sure about it.)

Disabling the overview of all links when link preview is disabled seems a bit confusing.
I agree. I should still be able to browse links by person who shared them and by date even if i don’t have link previews.

posts.name: Michael Franziskus
posts.cooked:
Back to initial topic:
It is still not possible to take a look at exchanged links in an conversation in the “All media” area.

Finding an received link from past on an specifics chat is really common.

When I do this it would also be nice to be able to use search-in-chat-feature to find results also within the links preview text.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Can this be considered under the ability to make links searchable? I can’t search any links most of the time because search seems to be broken for them. Can all platforms get a section dedicated to links please? It’s such a drag to find anything manually in Signal chats when they’re not searchable. Since links are not searchable, can there be a solution for this please?

Right now I try to avoid searching for links because it’s so cumbersome to find them.

What do you mean when you say links aren’t searchable? The text in URLs can be found via search and you can even flip through all the links in a chat quickly by searching “https”. The only thing you can’t find is text that is contained only in the preview.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: All of the above. Not all of my links start with https, and I’d prefer to directly search for content in the links themselves and the previews which don’t show up.

Herohtar:

The text in URLs can be found via search

Interesting. This definitely used to not be the case. They must have silently and unceremoniously fixed this at some point.

And while that’s great, and while searching for ‘https’ is a nice little hack that I’ve used in the past, still, it really would be SO much better to have a full list of all the links to be able to scroll through, rather than to just serially search through each one. Especially since for some chats I have dozens, if not hundreds of URLs. It’s so cumbersome to just search through them one-by-one rather than to be able to see them all in one list together.

EDIT: It’s possible I’m misremembering about not being able to search for text in URLs in mobile at some point. I might have just been thinking about Desktop, where you’re definitely still not able to search for text in URLs.

posts.name: Masqueey
posts.cooked:
Definitely also a big fan of the link collections to how WhatsApp also has it, independent of whether link preview is enabled.

Simply having a tab where I see all the links that were sent in the chat so I can easily find them again without having to search for https.

This would also create a better overview for chats where I send several links to the same website and need to differentiate between them.

Yes, I would also really like to have this feature. Searching for http helps in a lot of cases, but it doesn’t show any links that don’t have any prefix at all, e.g. “signal.org”.
Since many people don’t write the http part when they manually type out links, none of these links are easy to find.

Has anyone read the code well enough to know whether the underlining of links in the text body is being done with any mechanism that could be reused to collect all links in a chat?

desert_nip:

Has anyone read the code well enough to know whether the underlining of links in the text body is being done with any mechanism that could be reused to collect all links in a chat?

I think that is something done automatically by the OS, but I haven’t verified in the code.

Adding my voice here in support of this feature! I’d be happy with something similar to how it’s done in WhatsApp. Also open to a different design, so long as it’s some way to see a list of all links shared in the thread.

This feature request looks similar—perhaps they should be merged? Media, link, docs search/consolidate

clizzin:

perhaps they should be merged?

The threads are related, but merging isn’t a good idea, since feature requests are ideally supposed to be one-per-thread, which this one is.

That thread also mentions this one as the specific thread for this singular request.

links.title: Chat Search doesn't search for/find URLs
